meanings.definition: To make something wet or damp.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally sogged my socks by stepping in a puddle.
meanings.sent2: The rain will sog the ground and make it muddy.
meanings.sent3: The puppy loves to sog his toys in his water bowl.
meanings.sent4: Her tears began to sog the paper, smudging the ink.
meanings.sent5: The wet sponge will easily sog up the spilled milk.

meanings.sent1: After the storm, the yard was left in a sog from all the rain.
meanings.sent2: The old towel had a musty smell from being in a constant sog.
meanings.sent3: The sog in the basement caused a musty odor to linger.
meanings.sent4: The sog on the clothesline took longer to dry in the shade.
meanings.sent5: The sog on the picnic blanket made sitting uncomfortable.
